article.author: Devin Coldewey
article.title: Court victory legalizes 3D-printable gun blueprints
article.description: A multi-year legal battle over the ability to distribute computer models of gun parts and replicate them in 3D printers has ended in defeat for government authorities who sought to prevent the practice. Cody Wilson, the gunmaker and free speech advocate behin…

article.author: Matthew DeBord
article.title: Tesla fans and critics both need a reality check
article.description: The reality of Tesla's business is far more modest than the war over its stock price and market cap would suggest. Tesla is ultimately a small car company operating in a small market for electric vehicles.

video.title: Charger Desktop Ladegerät mit Qualcomm QC 3.0

article.author: Anthonie
article.title: Univision CEO: We're Selling The Onion, Gizmodo Because They Do 'Not Enhance Our Core Mission'
article.description: Univision confirms in a terse email to staff that it is selling Onion Inc. and Gizmodo Media Group.

article.author: Greg Trotter
article.title: Fresh Market closes stores, including 2 in Chicago area, as it tries to survive as 'specialty' store
article.description: The Fresh Market, an upscale grocery chain headquartered in North Carolina, announced Monday it will close 15 stores nationally, including four in Illinois.

article.title: Regulators Investigate Fast-Food Chains' Limits On Worker Recruitment
article.description: Ten states and the District of Columbia are asking fast-food chains about the use of so-called "no-poach" agreements that limit the ability of workers to switch jobs.

article.author: ABC News
article.title: Cities and states mull straw ban
article.description: Starbucks announced it will be going strawless soon to help the environment, joining governments and other private companies, but people with disabilities may suffer.

article.author: Sean O'Kane
article.title: FBI charges former Apple employee with stealing trade secrets from self-driving car project
article.description: The employee was allegedly trying to get a job at Alibaba-backed Xiaopeng Motors. He was arrested by the FBI while trying to leave the country over the weekend.

article.author: Ali Breland
article.title: House Dems worry FCC move to 'streamline' complaints will hurt consumers
article.description: Reps. Frank Pallone Jr. and Mike Doyle worry that the new changes will remove the FCC from this role, and instead force consumers into a complicated and costly legal process to address their issues.
